homelab-services/certmanager.title: Cert Manager
homelab-services/certmanager.description: cert-manager adds certificates and certificate issuers as resource types in Kubernetes clusters, and simplifies the process of obtaining, renewing and using those certificates.

homelab-services/k3s.title: K3s
homelab-services/k3s.description: K3s was significantly more lightweight, can be deployed much faster and still all all the key capabilities of K8s. There are a number of "production grade" features that are excluded from K3s such has handling of complex applications and intergrations with public cloud providers which I didn't require.

homelab-services/letsencrypt.title: Let's Encrypt
homelab-services/letsencrypt.description: LetsEncrypt is a nonprofit Certificate Authority that provides free TLS certificates to millions of websites all around the world.

homelab-services/metallb.title: Metallb
homelab-services/metallb.description: Metallb is the load balancer which I am currently using to expose my homelab services outside my cluster.

homelab-services/nfs.title: NFS Persistent Volumes Provisioner
homelab-services/nfs.description: Setting up NFS server and provisioner

homelab-services/traefik.title: Traefik
homelab-services/traefik.description: Traefik deploys a reverse proxy which intercepts and routes every incoming request to the corresponding backend services. It can also provide SSL termination and can be used with an ACME provider (like Letâ€™s Encrypt) for automatic certificate generation.

homelab-services/traefikdash.title: Traefik Dashboard
homelab-services/traefikdash.description: Create and deploy a middleware manifest that forces https:

intro.title: Documentation
intro.description: I see this area as a quick reference guide to complement my blog. It contains the all the key commands without any of the fluff. I hope to also use it as a spot to capture a backlog of things to try and useful kubernetes commands along the way.
